main: ^Does spending time in nature have proven mental health benefits? Nature exposure has been linked to improved mental well-being.
answer: ^Spending time in nature has been linked to improved mental well-being.
^Numerous studies suggest that nature exposure can have positive effects on mental health, including reduced stress, improved mood, and enhanced overall well-being.
^Activities such as walking in nature, hiking, or simply spending time outdoors have been associated with psychological benefits.
^This connection between nature and mental health is recognized in various fields, including psychology and environmental science.
